newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Bank, pharma shares lead Budapest bourse rise.
newsitem.headline: Bank, pharma shares lead Budapest bourse rise.

text.p: Hungarian share prices soared in active trade across-the-board on the Budapest Stock Exchange on Wednesday, as market participants returned after a public holiday here on Monday and Tuesday, traders said.
The BUX index ended at 3,286.88 points, up 115.44 or 3.64 percent, as spot share turnover totalled 1.45 billion forints.
BUX index futures ended higher for all maturities, by 120.00 to 140.00 points.
The Budapest bourse geared up to match the price rises of Hungarian shares traded in London earlier this week, traders said.

"A rising trend started late last week (here) and this continued at the beginning of this week in London," Gyorgy Czipo of ING Barings said. "Prices (of Hungarian shares) on the SEAQ reflected this," he said.
"This continued today and the two days (of public holiday) had to be 'made up for'," Czipo said, adding that most shares rode the horse.

Bank and pharmaceutical shares led today's rise. OTP Bank which released what analysts called better then expected first half results last week, soared a massive 295 forints or 13.11 percent to end at 2,545.
Of its deals, OTP had a huge block deal for 110,000 units at 2,500 forints/share price.
Trading in OTP shares was halted for a few minutes due to too rapid intraday price rise, traders said.

The day's heavy gainers included the other bank, Inter-Europa Bank which jumped 5.73 percent to end at 33,200 forints, as well as two of the three pharmaceuticals, Egis and Richter, and chemical company Borsodchem.
Egis closed at 9,100 forints, up 430. Richter, which soared to a new high of 7,905 forints, came off the new peak to close at 7,800 forints, up 210.
Borsodchem ended at 2,780, up 120 but below its 2,860 forints daily high.
Traders said they expected the trend to continue this week but the pace of rise was likely to slow down.
